text: 12 ounce bottle from the brewpub. Slightly hazy yellow, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of strong grassy hops, some onion. Pale malt. The taste is oniony, grassy hops, sweet pale malts (I guess that explains the corn). Medium bodied, moderate lingering bitterness. Nice!

On tap at Spare Time. Thick head. Not overly boozy but lots of flavor. Would drink again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is bready, grainy, corn, earthy hops, good. Appearance is golden golden amber, slightly hazy, white head. Taste is earthy hops, corn, bready, grainy, slightly slightly metallic. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, grainy earthy hop aftertaste. Overall, pretty solid imperial pils.

Bottle into glass with hakes, lamont, and wicker, clear yellowish slight haze pour with citrus aroma, taste is su[prisingly very good, never had an imperia;lamerican p[ilsner before, but I kinda like this shit a lot,

Poured from 12oz bottle. Really really good imperial lager. Crisp, clean, and easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Slightly hazy light gold in color with a medium white head. I dont get much for aroma, just slight floral, yeast, and bread notes. Thin body and medium carbonation. A funky sweet, bready taste up front balanced by a crisp bit of citrus and short-lived bitterness. Interesting and enjoyable.

Tasted and smelled vastly different when first opened, had an almost Belgianesque yeasty feel to it. I let it sit for a while and it really opened up, or the bad stuff dissipated. Big sweet light sugary maltiness with a fair amount of higher alcohols. Grassy earthy pine sol hops. Not a fan, but better the longer it sits.
Pours a golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is bread and grass, with some fruit. Flavor is sweet bread, some grass and earthiness, and a touch of fruit. Has a thick body feel. Decent.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of straw and hay with a bit of grain and earthiness underlying. Flavor has lots of bread and straw with a hint of grass in the finish.

Very mild malt aroma. Pours a clear light yellow with a thin white head. Starts with a slightly sweet malt aroma, with a big punch of hops, lots of pine and grassy notes. Very nice bitter finish, and light bodied. This is a really easy drinking beer, with the alcohol really well hidden.
A decent enough imperial lager. Grassy notes with a crisp finish. Nothing more but nothing less than you might expect

Not much of a scent. A hint of sweetness and a hint of grass. Pours a light gold where you can see the carbonation bubbles rising. No real head, just something that reminds me of dish soap, Hop presence hits the tongue first, but then finishes like bread. It is good for a pilsner or lager (not my styles of choice), but not something I would seek out.
Citrus, lemon and orange zest, caramel and notes of sugar cane. Nice hop bitterness throughout. Crisp finish and carbonation.

Bottle from Drakes party center. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves a lot of lacing. Not a ton on the nose. Tastes of straw on the tongue. Theres a hint of bitterness at finish to keep things tidy. Its sneaky big at 7% and real easy drinking. Solid!

Bottle. Pours a straw color. Small white head. Slightly sweet aroma. Flavor is sweet grass. Medium thick body. Bitter finish. This was ok, but Im not picking up the love that some of the other raters must have felt. Based on dates of the other raters Im guessing my bottle is a little old, but Id think at 7% it would have held up for a couple months.

Grassy hay with a little bit of light toasty grain in the aroma. Bottle from a recent trade. Flavor is good subtle and not too sticky sweet. Kicks up the pilsner style a bit to make it a little more full bodied and entertaining. Little bit of alcohol and band aid hops working.

12 oz bottle. The pour is a pretty good looking bright gold, like you'd expect in a pilsner. It's not really clear, and the head is pretty thin, but leaves great lace. The aroma is very citrusy with notes of yeast and malt. There isn't as much grain as you'd expect, which is a nice change of pace. The flavor is very citrusy on the front and then smoothes out. There isn't much else on the back end, other than a little dry hoppy finish. The mouth feel is a little thin, but the color and flavor suggest it won't be too thick 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden somewhat clear with a smaller white head. Aroma brings some light zest like yeast and a bit of sweet malts. Flavor brings smooth and crisp malty pilsner and Pilsner yeast flavors that give a German small hop bit to settle on the palate.

12oz bottle, big thanks to umich03jm. Few things in life I love more than fresh, unrated Shorts at my doorstep... One of the classiest looking shorts labels Ive ever seen, really nice-looking. Mostly clear yellow color. Very fine particles visible suspended in the body. Very nice ridges and spreads of lace. Good-looking beer, with the label to complement. Medium-plus body. Smooth, crisp, lighter carbonation, with a more dry finish. Great grassy hop aroma, bready, lightly peppery full pilsenery malt base, nice light lemon citrus. Great, big long pilsnery aftertaste. Pilsen malt really shines here; its a showcase of everything good about pilseners. Good moderate to bigger bitter taste, light to moderate sweetness, all in balance. No hint of the bigger alcohol in the taste, just a nice, more full body and bigger flavor. This manages to be a slightly bigger, more fuller flavored pils without being over the top hoppy and not at all hot, very impressive. Still true to style but big enough to qualify as imperial. It pretty much amps everything up I love about a good pils, and yet still manages to be very drinkable and quite refreshing. Maybe Im a shorts fanboy, maybe Im just in a beer mood, but this has got to be one of the most perfect imperial pilseners Ive ever tried... very well done in all aspects.

Bottled 9/17/13 and poured into a shaker pint.

Appearance: A cloudy "pure" yellow color. Pure yellow with nothing else there. Half finger or so of head bubbles away pretty quickly leaving a wispy bit of foam on top. Not much lacing.

Smell: As expected, smelling quite sweet. Like sugar and hay, mostly. Almost a fruity characteristic as well. Quite nice on the nose.

Taste/feel: First sip I didnt care for much, but then I realized I had brushed my teeth half an hour earlier. Once that first sip got my teeth re-dirtified, I was ready to go. The taste is much like the smell. This really is just what I had expected coming into this beer. Take an Pilsner with an average ABV (five or so), and add sweetness. Very low bitterness for me. I think this is 50 IBUs, but its balanced well. Sweet from beginning to end with that hay flavor typical to a good Pilsner, with almost a juiciness from fruit. Mouthfeel is medium with a medium amount of carbonation, making this pretty dangerously drinkable. Im going to shock some people by saying that I thought there was some corn in the flavor in a way, but Im not too sure. Whether they use corn or not (Id THINK not) in this beer, I get that vibe. Regardless, a super enjoyable beer. 

Im really not often a fan of Pilsners because I often find them bland and uninteresting, but I enjoy the body and sweetness of The Curl quite a lot.
Bottle. Clear light gold. Grain malt and alcohol aroma. Smooth and refreshing. Doesnt pair well with cool ranch Doritos. One of my favorite pilsners.-- rated with Beerbasher

Pours a clear yellow color with a large white head and lacing. Sweet golden aroma, biscuit, slight citrus. Medium body for the style, immediate biscuit sweetness on the tongue followed by a crisp clean finish, and hint of dry hop bitterness on the finish. This what I want in a pilsner.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2013 Overall not bad. ABV is a little high for what you get. Getting some pineapple in the flavor. Soft mouthfeel. Your average hoppy beer from Shorts.
Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours a clear gold with some frothy, white head. Nose of grass, malt, sugar, yeast, lemon. Flavor is malty, lemon, sugary, candy, grass. Clean finish. Decent.
On tap at the brewpub. Dirty yellow pour with a thin white head. A big Imperial pils with a nice complexity. Mild hop bitterness and malt sweetness combine in the aroma and taste. Stand out brew.
On tap at GABF 2013, grains and some sweet malt aroma and taste, it was ok.
Bottle. Pale golden yellow in color. Aroma of grain and alcohol. Taste is corn, grain, sweet malt. An OK pils, but not something Id want to drink a lot of.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2014 Bottle: Hazy, sunshine yellow, not much head on the pour, just a soapy white ring settled at the edge. Aroma is leafy hoppage, a little bit of corn, sweet pilsner malt, grains, some light, dusty DMS. Taste is far hoppier... Leafy and ashy with some citric peel notes. Sweet cake-y, pilsner malt backbone, mostly covered by hops, though. Some solvent-y alcohol notes come through that arent great. Mild corn and bready finish with a quite powerful, lasting bitterness. Not bad, but not exactly what I want in a pilsner.

Looks like cloudy Michelob, aroma was very mild. Initial flavor of grassy, bready malts with a snap of bitterness. After a while the bitterness took over. Not that it was super bitter, just that the bitterness was almost all there was. As it warmed, some stale bread flavor moved in and sat behind the hops. Eh, it was fair. Not my cup of tea. Shorts kind of throws all kinds of beers at you, but they are hit or miss IMO. This, for me, is a miss.
Pours a straw yellow with white head. Bread caramel straw aroma. Nice spicy hop character with some sweet notes. Medium body little carbonation. I really enjoyed this.
bottle. pours crisp bubbly light yellow with solid white head. sweet aroma biscuit honey and some hop. taste is sweet cake with some nice earth hop.

The Lost Notebook Files Beer #23. Not nearly as good as Shorts Spruce Imperial Pils. My issue with Imperial Pils is that I typically desire them on long hot days when a lower ABV is in order. Problematic. No good notes on the character, only a score. Bottle - Sicilianos Specialty Market - Grand Rapids, MI
Bottle (from backlog).  Strong sour and hay notes.  Flavors were big and pronounced instead of the watery pilsners Im used to.  Easily of my favorites of the style.

Bottle poured a hazy gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of straw, bread dough, spicy hops and light earthiness. Palate was medium  bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, bread, spicy hops and light earthiness with a smooth dry lingering bitter finish.

10th June 2011Slightly hazy gold beer. Little white head. Smooth and semi dry palate. Slightly creamy malt with traces of banana and bubblegum. Seamless mix of peach and grapefruit hops. Grapefruit bitterness dominates. Finishes semi dry. Lingering bitter aftertaste. Interesting and very drinkable.

Sample at GABF 10/13/2012, thanks to Bluemeow76 for assistance with note-taking. Clear pale golden color with a medium fluffy white head and spotty lacing. Aroma of hops and spice. Medium body with a mildly bitter herbal hops character with some grainy malt behind it. The finish is lightly hoppy. Decent overall.

On tap Birch & Barley Wash. DC.  Pours a bright golden color with a one finger head that disappears quickly.  Aroma is a mix of bitter and floral hops with just a touch of alcohol coriander and lemon peel.  The coriander is surprisingly potent, balanced by honey with a great hop finish. The beer gets more pronounced as it warms.  Dry, lingering bitter finish.  Light bodied and smooth.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.

The beer is light yellow hued with a mild haze. The head is long lasting, leaving ample lacing on the glass. 

The aroma brings some hops, sweetness, citrus, and alcohol. The flavor is really enjoyable. 

A quality beer from Shorts. Reminiscent of an American IPA to some degree, as the hop profile stands out more so than the malt bill. 

The feel is medium bodied. A hint of alcohol presence emerges in the finish.

A solid brew. I would have it again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 06-10-2011

Bottle:   Pale straw, moderate frothy white head, sticky lacing.   Bright straw/hay on the nose, dry grass, a touch of wheat, with a bit of hops to it.   Soft sweet straw, heavy in flavor, a touch dry, with a bit of hops on the backside.   This one is very flavorful, is well balanced, and clean.   Hops tend to linger well after the finish.   Moderate to full body and mouthfeel.   Easily one of the better Imperial Pils out there.   Thanks for this treat Kevin!

Thanks to thirdeye11 for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma has a lot of pilsner malt, with some grass thrown in. The flavor is more of the same. I get a ton of the lighter pilsner and biscuit malt, as well as some grass and floral hop notes. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Pours a clear pale yellow color with a slight amount of head.  Flowery and grass like hop aroma along with a slight amount of malt.  Taste is pretty smooth, grassy hops and grainy malt.  Slightly spicy and lemony on the tongue too.  Alcohol is well hidden.  A very solid imperial pilsner.

Draft to pint. Looks good; yellow with nice head. Smells good too; happy and grainy. Tastes solid; happy and surprisingly light and refreshing for 7.1%. Nice on the palate too. This is a very good imperial pilsner!

3.9 Bottle pour into pint glass. Light yellow with big fluffy head. Sweet, spicy  floral, with nice bitter finish.  I first tried it last year and couldnt get more. I looked forward to getting this excellent seasonal pilsener this year.

12 ounce bottle into pilsener glass, bottled 4/26/2012.  Pours fairly clear bright golden straw color with a nice 2 finger dense white head with nice retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Some decent soapy lacing on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up retaining the head.  Aromas of big lemon, citrus peel, herbal, grass, earth, bread, pepper, apricot, and yeast spiciness.  Nice, well balanced, and pleasant aromas; with nice hoppiness and decent strength.  Taste of big lemon, bread, pepper, orange peel, grapefruit, grass, earth, and herbal spiciness.  Decent sized herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, citrus, bread, pepper, and herbal spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance of flavors, with just the right amount of hop bitterness to balance it out.  Flavors definitely showcase the hops more than aromas(which are more of a standard pilsener aroma).  Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy and fairly crisp mouthfeel.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden with hardly any warming present on the finish.  Very easy to drink for being over 7%.  Overall this is a damn nice and well made imperial pilsener.  Nice hoppy flavors with great malt balance; and dangerously easy to drink.  Really enjoyable stuff.
pale golden with small head. very impressive flavor in this one. a big hoppy bite with a great bitter finish.
Light golden color. Frothy white head, big grassy nose with a touch of grapefruit. Lovely. Very nice citrsy grassy mouth. Very clean. Dry bitter finish. Very bitter.

12oz bottle. Had this right after a pint of Duvel and The Curl held its own against the fabled brew from Belgium. While The Curl was slightly less refined than the Duvel it was none-the-less as complex and drinkable. Well done.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Tasted from a bottle shared by a generous RB member at Flossmoor Stations Pre-DLD party 2011.  Pours clear, bright yellow, with an average white head that slowly recedes to rocky, spotty lace.  The nose is marshmallow sweet, with caramel, and some resin bitter hops.  The flavor is caramel sweet, with orange peel, and resin hops bitterness.  The body is medium with average carbonation, and a long resin bitter finish.

(12oz bottle) clear pale yellow with a ring of fine white bubbles. Nose of crisp grain, alcohol, a bit of hairspray, but clean-smelling for the most part. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, citrus oils, very bitter finish and pine linger.

Slightly hazy golden coloured body with a very large (three centimetres tall) white head with a perfect lace and small bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma of nice lemons, alcohol, malt, fresh herbal and dry hops and a nice light airy note. Medium-bodied; Very pungent flavour of malt and bitter hops that show prominently at first then carry on more of a metallic and pungent kick of alcohol near the end. Aftertaste is definitely masked by these bitter and deep flavours with almost nothing else getting through. Strong, just the like the style indicates and between this and other deep lagers over in Eastern Europe, there isnt much between the two, aside from perhaps a touch more hops over here in the states. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Merchants in Dearborn, Michigan on 28-April-2011 for US$1.99 sampled at home in Washington on 30-September-2011.

(12oz bottle, courtesy of thirdeye11)  Pours a clear yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of grass, grain, florals, and citrus.  Flavor of grass, citrus, grain, caramel, and florals with a dry, bitter finish.

Poured into a pils glass. 

4.0 A: Hazed golden yellow color. Nearly four fingers of white, pillowy head. Retention is pretty good and it leaves a strange lattice of lacing.

3.5 S: This smells like it was jam packed with orange peel and lemon rind. Simply tons of it floating into my nostrils. Grassy and lightly spicy hops. Far from clean, but not too muddled with yeastiness. Bready and somewhat floral overall.

2.0 T: The taste, however, is a bit too muddled. Full of yeastiness with too much bread and biscuit. Grassy, earthy hops give a bitterness that is just too strong for the style. Orange peel and lemon rind are back, but they fall behind too many intense, but unwanted flavors. This is not what I want from a pilsner, whether imperial or not.

2.5 M: Heavier medium body from the intense yeastiness. Good moderate carbonation. Chewy without being equally creamy. Far from smooth with a bitter aftertaste.

2.0 D: This is the antithesis of what I would want from the style. Heavy, overly bready and yeasty, and far from clean. Not refreshing at all and otherwise not satisfying.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-18-2011 03:14:53

12oz bottle thanks to northernbrews, pours a hazy light golden with a thin head and spotty lacing, aroma is of slight fruit with some cracker and grass, flavor has classic pisler taste with a fruity and hoppy finish, pretty decent.

Bottle courtesy thirdeye11. Pours a clear light gold color with little carbonation apparent. Aroma is pilsener malts, grain and some light fruit. Dry flavor that is pretty hoppy, sharp grains with  light sweetness.

Shorts The Curl 07-06-11 6/2/7/4/ok
Straw yellow with a creamy beige topper and moderate lacing.  Aroma is grassy, sweet and noble, pretty much a pilsener.  Taste is pilsener as well, super sized.  Very sweet with some alcohol, noble hops, plenty of pale malts and a nice bitter finish.  Its not bad, but in a lipstick on a pig sort of way.
bottled, thanks to thirdeye11, clear golden color with a sweet fruity body, has some floral notes and sweet aroma, finish is bitter

Thanks to FlandersNed for this one in trade.  Pours hazy yellow-gold with a frothy white head.  Nose is pilsner malt, sweetness, and grassy hops.  Flavor is sweet in the front, which quickly gives way to sharp lemon, then then grassy hops, then citrus pith.  Lots of bitter lemon with some pith behind it.  Interesting take on the style with minimal yeasty/ lager quality.

This is a pretty pilsener. I had Atwater Block Uber Ursa yesterday, and while it was an decent beer, this one is much prettier. Gold in color, with a decent head, and slight lacing. Good hops. Nice pils.

A: The beer pours a pale golden color with a big white head on top.

S: Quite sweet with a bit of a grainy feel to it (as in sugar granules).  Some table sugar, a hint of pineapple, and some very floral and perfumey hops.  A touch of grass and lager yeast are also there.

T: Big time perfume and floral flavors to the beer.  Mild bread and cooked grain flavors with some grass and orange peel.  The bitterness is light, but theres also some astringency to the beer.  Not quite as sweet as I had expected.

M: Medium in body and carbonation.

O: I liked this beer well enough, but there were a few off characters to it that did just enough to put me off.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a bright golden color with a lot of carbonation and big, thick white head.  Aroma of leafy hops with biscuity, bready malts.  Flavor is mildly bitter, mildly sweet.  Lots of doughy malts beneath the leafy and grassy hops.  Mild sweetness.  The alcohol is subdued.  Full-bodied.  Finishes long and bitter.  This is a really good imperial pils.  So drinkable.
Shorts Shorts Shorts Shorts Shorts Shorts! Yummyyy. Try it. Not their best but grows on you.

Pours a slightly hazy gold with a creamy white head. Nose is sweet pils malt, heavy corn grains, and lemony fresh hops. Taste is slightly spicy and estery. Creamy mouthfeel. the aroma is superior. I expected a cleaner flavor and the American hops didnt meld all that well.

12 oz bottle.  Pours golden with just a little bit of fine particles and a white head.  Nice hop aromas, combination of earthy noble hop aromas combining with herbal spicy hop aromas as well.  Hops come across quite spicy with herbal, earthy, and hints of pine flavors.  Little bit of honey and pilsener malt.  Lasting bitterness.  Rather nice, a touch overbearing, though.

12 oz bottle shared by sleestak. Thanks! Pours a faintly hazed deep dark golden pour, touches of orange, with a bigger frothy bright white head. Laces good, thicker film. Aromas are touches of pine, stinky pilsner malts and yeast, with some lighter floral and piney hops. Lighter. Initial preaches that yeast to a T. Stinky pils yeast, bread dough, spicy yeast, some pine, weeds, grass. Moving into some bread dough, finish is decent bitterness, more earthy hops. Nice.
Less hop aroma, and more malt sweetness than many Pils. Cloudy golden color with solid body. Bottom line is that it was that I enjoyed it!

12 oz bottle: Appearance is a clear golden with a thick white head that lingers. Aroma is almost a fruity hop texture, very slight yeast characteristic, slightly grassy, and an overall really wonderfully scent. Taste has got a nice hop bite to it upfront, floral, grassy, fruity, hoppy. Then it falls off into a nice clean aftertaste with a lingering fruity hop resin. Overall, Nice stuff nothing spectacular but solid all around. Cheers!

12 ounce bottle pours a light golden color with a fluffy white head that climbs up the side of the pint glass.  Smells of cereal and floral hobs.  Light hop taste with a creamy mouth feel.  I get a bit of a soapy aftertaste.  Possibly the oily hops.

Light off white head on top of a golden slightly orange almost cartoonish colored beer.  Aroma is very light and sweet, ever so slight hops and wheat.  Taste is of biscuit and heavy on the hops with a dry lingering finish that is slightly sweet and spicy.  The mouthfeel is slightly thick and oily.

Bottle, 
this beer has a clear gold pour (a little darker, fuller gold color than your typical lager-pilsner) and gave a one to two finger white head that deflated to a cover and ring after a few minutes, the effervescence was light in this beer, a gentle single stream of bubbles in the center of the glass, and left spots and layers of lacing on the glass, there was a partial film of sediment on the bottom of the bottle, 

the aromas were light toasted malt, a citrus sour that resembles lemon with cracker and bread like aromas, 

the flavors were light malt, bread, grain, and has a good sour touch on the tongue, there is little sweetness in this beer at first part of the sip, 
the hops add a gentle bitterness and works well with the sourness of the beer to give a good finish, 

the mouth feel is around medium, it may feel a little thicker than medium but it feels light for an Imperial Pilsner, 

the alcohol is hidden well in this beer and it is not overly sweet like some, a nice ESL.

Pour from a 12 oz bottle. Golden brew with a big white head. Aroma dominated by light hops. Great flavor with a light graininess very quickly melding a a fine hops bitterness. Hard to imagine it 7.5 ABV - not a hint of booziness, even when warm. Excellent brew.
Alcohol was well hidden here. A light bitterness is balanced with a touch of bread. A little light and lacked a real memorable flavor.

On tap at Sunset for their Shorts event prior to EBF.  Pours a clear gold with a thin white head.  Nutty malt and crackers, fuzzy light grain.  Grainy with some cracker and biscuit notes.  Toast, grain, crackers on the finish.

Draft sample. Poured cloudy golden color with medium frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Medium balanced aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met..

8/28/2008, bottled 4/20/06, courtesy of generalgao.  #135/1000.  Cloudy golden with a small off-white head, some chunky white things in the body.  Aroma is of earth and biscuits, light yeasty bread.  Flavor is pretty darn bitter with some doughy biscuits.  Bitterness peaked at a 7, dry finish.High carbonation with a medium body.  Bah, this was too old when we drank it, unfortunately--had trouble picking out any aroma hops.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: On tap @ Sheffields pours a gazed yellow orange. Light citrus nose touch of yeast. Citrus flavors that have a slight tartness. Earthy hops with a strong grassy bitterness. Hides that alcohol well. But that tartness and grassy bitterness make it less enjoyable

750 ml bottle shared by Odeed. Nose is caramel, light oxidation, and sweetness. Cloudy gold with a big pale golden head. Flavor is peppery, light bitterness, caramel, lots of oxidation, and cardboard. Wish I had this fresh!
yellow body with a fizzy white head.aroma is wheat,apples,sugar,and caramel malts.flavor is seltzer water,caramel malts,and belgian candy.i think this one is past its prime.
Bottle at DLD ... thanks to Yaniv ... Hazy amber ... bright light sweet hop ... juicy front ... sweet light yeast hop ... little cloves... ok

Thanks to Yaniv for bringing this to DLD!  A few years old.  Poured hazy paler golden with a loose-bubbled cap of white head.  The aroma picked up soft, aged lighter fruity sweetness and a bit of pineapple.. lightly toasty and well-composed.  The flavor found mostly pale malt at the core with pineapple, black pepper, and warm oxidized character around.. bitterness was mostly gone.. a bit hot at the finish.  Medium-bodied with scratchy carbonation on the palate.. the oxidation made it rough right at the finish.  This held up decently.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2011 
Date: April 25, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, DLD
Appearance: cloudy yellow, frothy white head
Aroma: sweet spicy aroma, touch of lemony citrus
Flavor: sweet and spicy flavor, lots of floral and spicy hops, slightly grassy, long bitter finish
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: **+ /4
Auburn in color with a fluffy beige head that diminishes and craters. Alcohol completely hidden. Sour white grape juice, light tartness. Great balance in the flavors. Hoped back end not overwhelming.

Bottle 135 of 1000. Poured a hazy light orange color. The head was white with good retention and lacing. Fruit forward nose including the likes of citrus and a bit of white grape. I also smelled cereal grains, some butter, and light grass. Medium bodied and slightly sweet with moderate bitterness. Effervescent with spruce, toffee, and a little apricot in the flavor. Nice.

thanks to general_gao!  Clear gold pour with a very fluffy white head.  Earthy hop aroma.  Flavor was lemon,  citrus,  earth,  pine.  Bitter finish with a snappy amount of carbonation,  dry.  I think this one was well over a year old and has held up surprisingly well.

750ml bottle acquired in trade with ogglethorp (thanks!). 2006 Vintag. # 288 / 1000. Poured a deep yellow color with a larger sized white head. Aromas of citrus, grassy, and bready. Tastes of the same with some caramel.

Poured a dark golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of floral hops, pils malt, caramel, toffee, grass, and toasted dough.  Taste was sweeter, caramel, toast, toffee malts, grassy hops, light caramel, and a bitter, hoppy finish, with low alcohol in the end.

Thanks to hopdog for sharing this one.  Pours a lightly hazy golden with a bubbly white head that left some lacing.  Aroma of noble hops, some citrus notes, bready, a little grassy with notes of lemon and some candy sweetness. I liked the nose on this one.  Flavor of bready malt, a little sweet, noble hop flavor, some hop bitterness followed by some bready sweet malt.

Hazy golden, nice white head. Decent floral/lemongrass aroma up front, no malt to speak of, rotten pears? in the background. Flavor much the same, some faint pils/pale malt comes through, but not much. Not very clean for a pils, now listed as a euro strong lager anyway.
more bitter than it is malty this is not a bad drink. From an experimental brewery that makes as many hits as misses this one was close, but a bit off.

750 ml bottle
For some reason I thought this would be a great thing to buy when at Bella Vino.  Instead it was an acceptable "imperial pilsener" that was not worth the $15.99. If you have a bottle share it with others soon because it did not seem like the sort of beer that will age well.
Aroma / Appearance - A huge billowing head filled my glass with mostly foam before it settled into a golden hued body.  Wheat, grain and white bread formed a bland nose that left me a little bored.  I expected something slightly stronger from a pilsener.
Flavor / Palate - The mouthfeel was thick and chewy as expected but the flavors were dulled down.  Wonder bread drizzled in honey with a slight tartness and mildly funky finish was not complex at all.  In fact at some point it became cloying.  I was glad to see the glass empty by the end of the sample.

Bottle at C-bus 10.  Shared by Brigadier I believe.  Aroma of yeast, very flowery and perfume-like as well.  Light golden brown body with a big head.  Medium palate with very high carbonation.  Very floral taste with plenty of yeast and a biting, bitter finish.

Big white head, foamy over a light golden yellow.  Big peppery hops.  Floral resin to some extent too.  Aha, amarillo, thats what I thought!  Sweet malt.  Herbal hop a bit too.  Big mouthfeel, a bit viscous, maybe even syrupy?  Big ass peppery hops against a sweet toasty malt.  Alcohol is slightly perceivable.  Theres something here that slightly reminds me of High Life... and Im not sure it doesnt work here.  Rather bitter, but not so fruity hops.  A bit of tuttifruiti though.  Jucier as it warms.  Lingering bitterness.

Bottle conditioned - pour slowly to prevent the cloudiness.  Clear medium gold color, lively carbonation and thick head of fluffy white foam.  Clumpy lacing.  Mild malt and a little grassy hop character in the aroma.  First sip was much more hops than anticipated - masking the malt.  Subsequent sips still have a citrus and flowery pungency with a mellow pilsner malt character well behind.  Smooth body with long citrusy and ever so slightly spicy hop aftertaste. Bottle #714 of 1000 purchased Aug 07 in Rochester Hills.

750ml - Brewed 04/20/06 #281 of 1000 - Aroma of dry grass, straw, pilsner malts and mild floral hops.  Pours slightly hazy gold with a huge fluffy head and great lacing.  Very attractive.  Flavor is pretty hoppy considering its age.  Floral and citrus hops blend perfectly with the pilsner malts and dry farmland from the aroma.  Palate is crisp and tart.  I wasnt expecting much due to its low ratings here but was pleasantly surprised.  This is a well crafted and very tasty brew.  My first from Shorts and Im sure it wont be the last.

RBSG 07 Minneapolis Grand Tasting: Hazy blonde/yellow. Nice head and lacing. Nose of bright hop, catty and grassy, nice hoppy yeast and pilsner malts. Nice sweet hoppy, balanced and pleasant. Yeasty, lemon. Good.

The Dan journal #86.  Tasted 5/29/2007.  750ml bottle.  Hazy and golden hued.  Touch straw hue.  Finger width of tight bubbled clinging white head.  Aromas of cereal and vanilla icing.  Citrus notes.  Full bodied and lively.  Zesty.  Nice bitterness.  Great flavor.  Grainy cirtus flavors.  Big, big alcohol kick.  Tart and lemony with a nice 7-Up effervescence.  Good but not great.

Sample from 22 ounce bottle, RBSG Minneapolis Grand Tasting, June 23 2007.  Gorgeous, pillowy, enormous off-white bubbly head tops a bright golden body and leaves chunky lacing as it slowly subsides....the aroma is perfect pils just as the appearance is, grainy and fresh with leafy/grassy hops and plenty of bready pils malt....thick body is just a touch syrupy, perhaps a bit more alcoholic than Id want, but very pils-like in most respects, grainy and honeyish at the front, dry and fairly bitter and light/crisp at the finish....the fruitiness betrays the American hops, and it is a bit boozy, but otherwise, this is just a wonderful, straightforward pils.  $15 a bottle?  I dunno, but if it were half that and available in Vermont Id be getting some more for sure.  Thanks so much Argo0!

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2007 RBSG 07  I really liked this despite the grapefruit nose and bitter finish. Crisp and refreshing. Rerate 10th Columbus Tasting (Christmas 2007)---wht is an imperial plisner anyway?
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: Hazy yellow, big fluffy head, floral aroma.  Shockingly bitter front, with grassy/vegetal and floral notes around the palate.  Jeckyll and Hyde of a beer.  This is the beer for which I threw the remnants on Walt at RBSG 07--he deserved it!  :-)

(RBSG07, 750ml bottle, 2006 vintage) Lightly hazed straw body topped by medium off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, floral, grassy.  Taste is medium sweet, sharp grassy, some grapefruit.  Medium body, low cabonation, some acidity.  Actually tastes like a pilsner, which, for the Imperial Pilsner category, is saying something.
RBSG07. From 75 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit floral hops. Flavour is malty mild sweet and very floral. Decent bitterness in the finish. Good bitter finish.
Sampled at the RBSG 07 Grand Tasting.  Faint grain aroma on this one.  Watery pilsner malt flavor.  Bitter finish.  Not bad for a pils.

Shorts The Curl Imperial Pilsner
750 ml bottle
Moderate pour in tulip glass.
Brewed 04/06, straightened out 06/07

Poured a clear hazy gold with a huge fizzy rocky somewhat lasting white head with good lacing.

Smelt of moderate bread and grain and grassy hops.

Taste was upfront strong bitter grass and moderate sweet banana bread, followed by a strong bitter grassy and moderate bittersweet banana yeast.

Palate was medium bodied, slightly creamy, strongly astringent and lively carbonation.

Overall, wow a lot of hops here!  Even after a year its still held up great.  In fact its better than when I tried it a year ago.  Very bitter super pilsner.  Good stuff.  Taste light a very light bodied IPA.

A $15 pilsner.  It is good, even if ridiculously overpriced.  Well carbonated.  A bright, gold color and a tall white head.  It has a nice pilsner bitterness with medium bodied malt and considerable hops.

750 mL bottle-tag says 4-20-06.  Boy, if price and packaging is indicative, this should be out of this world.  Comes in a big bottle, nice label, an attached tag with information and the like... fancy.  The original price on this was $20, so theyre obviously pretty proud of it, too.  I got a nice closeout deal on it... 5 bucks.  Figured it might be worth trying at that price.  Pour is pretty nice... golden color with some amber shades.  Head on the first glass was about three fingers and its dying down as I type, leaving lots of nice lacing on the side of the glass.  Aromas are interesting and somewhat unique... lemon peel, grass, floral hops and maybe a touch of grapefruit hiding in the background.  Its not an overpowering nose, but pleasant.  First impression of the flavor is that the alcohol is a little out of balance and takes it in an astringent direction without enough of a malt body to support it well.  It seems like as it sits and breathes a little it is becoming a little more managable.  Flavors are still a little bitter, though.  Lemon peels and summer grass are my best description, with that alcoholic unbalance pulling things away from purely enjoyable.  Still, nice.  Id be willing to pay $5...
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle shared at the Columbus Tasting V: Orange yellow pour with a white head. Aroma was perfumey...some lemon zest and some yeast as well. The flavor held some yeast, light grass notes, and a bit of lemon. Light mouthfeel with a dry finish.
Columbus tasting V shared by sliffy. Aroma was of apples, sweetness, crisp pilsner. Flavor seemed a little bitter  and just off. Just not that great and way over priced.
Shared at Columbus Tasting V.Some slight spice and some yeast in the aroma.Pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head.Yeast and grass in the flavor.Mouthfeel is thin with a bitter finish.

Bottle shared at the Columbus Tasting V: Golden color with a white head. Aroma, yeast, spicy hops, some bready malts. Flavor, yeasty, some grassy and spicy hops. Light bodied, clean finish. Pretty decent.
Sampled at Columbus tasting. Pale gold in color. Nice head. Flavor was bitter and very hoppy to me, and I did not really care for this one at all. Not my style.

750 ml bottle sampled at Columbus Tasting V - Pours pale golden with a white fluffy head that stays pretty well.  Aromas of yeast grains and slight noble hops.  Flavor is yeasty with lots of grain and some noble hops and some kind of styrofoam flavor in the background.  Palate is clean and light.

bottle.
cloudy yellow with a lasting white head. cantalope nose with cinnamon. flat brew that is corntastic. has a nice hop flavor. some stem & wood here that i like.
3 6 6 3 13

hazy orange body with large foamy head..aroma of citrus, spice, and wheat...flavor is that of a strong lager (there is some citrus element to it as well)..evident bitter, piney hop kick with an alcohol finish...nice

Pours straw yellow with a fizzy white head and lined lacing.  Aroma is soapy and potato malt (grain, meal), yeast (sweat, dough), fruit and flowers, grass.  Medium bitter and acidic yeasty flavor, sweat and alcohol, grainy meal.  Medium bodied and fizzy, dry palate.

750. Beer is murky medium bright yellow-gold with a large, frothy, white, mostly lasting head.

The aroma is malty with light notes of toasted grain, trace of caramel; Hoppy with a light grassy vegetal note, trace of rosemary, lemon zest; Yeast is light soapy; Trace miscellaneous note of green apple peel, clove, underripe pear.

The flavor is moderately sweet, moderately-to-heavily bitter, trace acidic with a long, moderately bitter, lightly sweet finish.

The body is medium, the texture is velvety and the carbonation is lively.

Cloudy sediment-laden apricot body, thick puffy off-white head.  Looks like apple cider mixed with tang.  Bready aroma with light citrus and grassy, bitter hops.  Sweet citrus body, bready, strongly yeasty, which adds a creaminess to the body.  Bitter, grassy, somewhat citric hops at the finish in addition to tropical fruits.  The hops give this an IPA character.  Im not buying this as a pilsener.  Pretty good but not worth the $16 tag.

Wonderful thick head - long lasting with a flavor of grass and sharp hop bitterness when the head is sampled.  Almost like tasting a farm yard and thats a good thing.   Unbelievable golden color with great carbonation that tingles on the tongue.  This is a wonderful pilsner, and as it warms you get a more citrus and some pine.  I got this beer from a friend in Michigan, I need more.  Well this is a live and full of yeast, my second glass plopped out a ton of yeast and of course its not very cloudy almost like a wheat beer.  I now taste an almost clove like flavor - still damn good.

On tap at MI brewers guild fest. Cloudy orange/yellow pour with thin bleached white head. Lots of citric rind in the nose with some hops, and just a little bit of candy to follow. FLavours are massive grapefruit and citrus witha good hops bitterness. Dry, lingering bitter finish. Good! I liked this brweies tent!

UPDATED: APR 22, 2011 Bottle:  Light-moderate citrus and grass along with some spicy hops.  It pours a transparent golden-orange with a one finger white head that leaves behind some wispy lacing.  Light sweet citrus up front with touch of orange peel.  The finish has moderate pine, grass, and spicy hops.  A nice pilsner that comes across as an IPA.
